The Ingevity North Charleston Plant's emergency response plan is contained in the Integrated Contingency Plan (ICP).  This plan identifies the protocols and procedures utilized in an abnormal release or spill event when there is concern that it may lead to an emergency condition.  These plans define the criteria for identifying, classifying, and notifying appropriate emergency response staff of potential emergency events.  This ensures that those with more significant possible consequences receive immediate priority for appropriate emergency response.  If an abnormal event indicates the potential for the release of a chemical and quantity that may lead to an emergency condition, the plant emergency response team is notified and the most appropriate mode of response is determined by the Plant Emergency Coordinator or Incident Commander, with support from available emergency response and technical advisory staff.  

Training of responsible staff from both the North Charleston Chemical Plant and the Plant Emergency Response Team is designed to ensure that reliable communication and coordination occurs in any emergency situation.  The North Charleston Chemical Plant has a continuous safety improvement program which includes prompt investigation and reporting of all spill- or release-related events, even when there is no immediate threat of off-site exposure.

3.2 Program 3 Applicability

The formaldehyde solution system in at the Ingevity North Charleston Plant is subject to Program 3 Accidental Release Prevention (ARP) Requirements under CFR Part 68.  

4.0   ACCIDENT PREVENTION

The process is subject to the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management Standard (PSM) with which the Ingevity facility is in compliance. This program minimizes the potential for accidental releases and helps Ingevity maintain a safe facility.  Ingevity has in-place specific operational programs to address PSM Prevention Program requirements.  These include:

*Preventive Maintenance Program

*Tank Integrity Program

*Regular Process Hazards Analysis (HAZOP Studies) and Pre-Startup Safety Checks for Changes as Part of Management of Change Program

*Incident Review, Diagnosis and Correction (to Prevent Recurrence)

*Written Operating Procedures

*Operator Training and Testing Program


5.0   EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

Consistent with Program 3 requirements, the Ingevity North Charleston Plant has trained Emergency Response Teams and coordinates emergency response with the local emergency planning and response agencies, including the North Charleston police and fire departments.

The lignin production area includes a number of reactors that produce a variety of products. Formaldehyde solution is delivered to the site via tank truck in the form of a 37% aqueous solution and stored at slightly elevated temperature in an above ground tank with a 30,000 gallon (270,000 lb) capacity.  The tank is surrounded by a 30 ft x 30 ft dike that provides passive mitigation by limiting the surface area of a spill.

The EPA Risk Management Regulation identifies three levels of requirements defined as programs.  Ingevity has determined that the production process that uses formaldehyde is a Program 3 process.  Program 3 applies to processes that are subject to Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management Standard (PSM) or listed among nine North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) codes.  The process belongs to a listed NAICS code (325199, industrial organics), and is subject to PSM.

The Risk Management Plan requirements for Program 3 processes are the same as those for the PSM standard.


3.0   HAZARD ASSESSMENT RELEASE SCENARIOS

The Hazard Assessment under the ARP program consists of two parts; 1) a review of the five-year accident history involving regulated substances in the covered process and 2) a modeling evaluation of the impact associated with an accidental release.  There have been no accidental releases during the most recent five-year period that had an off-site impact, however, modeling of a worst-case release shows that off-site concentrations of formaldehyde would exceed the toxic endpoint concentration.  The Ingevity North Charleston plant is subject to Program 3 ARP requirements.

Ingevity owns and operates a specialty chemicals manufacturing facility in North Charleston, South Carolina which is subject to U.S. EPA regulations governing Accidental Release Prevention (ARP) Requirements: Risk Management Programs under Section 112(R) of the Clean Air Act (40 CFR Part 68).  This Risk Management Plan (RMP) has been developed in accordance with the requirements specified under 40 CFR Part 68, Subpart G.  The RMP certifies that Ingevity has instituted a Risk Management Program at the North Charleston, South Carolina facility that is in compliance with U.S. EPA ARP requirements. 

The RMP includes an Executive Summary and Data Elements following the format published by U.S. EPA.  In addition to identifying the applicable corporate policies and risk management systems, including comprehensive accident prevention and emergency response programs, this RMP document identifies the worst case release scenario, alternate release scenario, and the facility's five year accidental release history.
